intro: Erythrospermum coffeaefolium, commonly known as the coffee-leaf erythrospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
